reasoning: Sleep apnea syndromes are chronic conditions better characterized by prevalence. Population prevalence estimated at 4-5% (4,000-5,000 per 100k) based on community-based studies. Using midpoint of 4.5% (4,500 per 100k) as global prevalence estimate.
source: Marin JM et al. (2005). Long-term cardiovascular outcomes in men with obstructive sleep apnoea-hypopnoea. Lancet. 365:1046-1053
